content.question: The graph above shows the distribution of molecular speeds for four different gases at the same temperature. What property of the different gases can be correctly ranked using information from the graph, and why?

choices.label: The densities of the gases, because as the density of a gas increases, the average speed of its molecules decreases.
The pressures of the gases, because the pressure exerted by a gas depends on the average speed with which its molecules are moving.

The volumes of the gases, because at a fixed temperature the volume of a gas can be calculated using the equation <math alttext="P V equals n R T" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>P</mi><mi>V</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>n</mi><mi>R</mi><mi>T</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The molecular masses of the gases, because the gas molecules have the same average kinetic energy and mass can be calculated using the equation <math alttext=" K E sub average, equals, one half m v squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi><mi>E</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>avg</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mi>m</mi><msup><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>.
